name: The Northam All Suite Penang

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived to find that our booking made on the hotel website was nowhere on their records! Although we were worried about not having anywhere to stay they apologised and offered us an upgrade at a price that was considerably cheaper than our original booking... great start!
reviews.title: Northam is very good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Deluxe Suite was huge with a large lounge room with seperate study (with cable internet), a large bedroom with a huge king size bed and an enormous bathroom with a spa, seperate shower and toilet.
reviews.title: Still Good and Large

likes.liked: — Large rooms, double toilets and TV

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are large and modern but general cleaning and maintenance could be better. TV's are small which was not in keeping with the style of the rest of the place.
reviews.title: Nice but expensive

likes.disliked: — Paying extra for internet access and telephone use

reviews.title: great customer service
reviews.text: Housekeeping was good with clean towels and sheets daily. Daily breakfast was good but same every day. the Door staff were terrific and very helpful - the hotel limo service was good quality and not much more expensive than a cab of the street.
The location is not "in the centre of the action" but is within easy drive of both Georgetown and the Beaches. Tip: drive to the beach and try the Ferringi Garden Restaurant... a gem.
reviews.title: Not so 'SUITE'

reviews.text: I loved this hotel and agree with the comments in the other reviews here. This was my second time in Penang, so I knew the area I wanted to stay in before I booked. The Northam is a short walk from both Gurney Drive, where the action is, and Georgetown centre (about 15 minutes' walk, although the pavements can be decidedly dodgy in places). I booked a deluxe suite and got a huge suite with two toilets, bath, shower, two sinks, two oversized-single beds (120cm+), a sitting room with dining table, sofa and a tv (there was an extra tv in the bedroom too). Food within the hotel restaurants was excellent and extremely good value for money. The staff were friendly, spa treatments were cheap. There is a small pool on the 9th floor, but all the sunbeds are under a roof, so that was a slight disappointment for us sun-starved bunnies from northern Norway....otherwise, this hotel represents the best value I have found in the area.
reviews.title: Keep up the Good Work!
Best in Town
reviews.text: I stayed at the Northam for 6 nights while visiting friends and family in Penang. It's worth pointing out that I moved there from its sister hotel The Gurney (a short walk away) after viewing the room. Given the excellent service I received and how nice the room is, I feel almost obliged to write this review. Let me begin with the room itself: I stayed in Room2805 on the 28th floor (lowest floor is 24th), a studio suite that comes with, all the obvious aside, a lounge, a guest cloakroom, wall-to-wall windows which give you a 180-degree sea view, a fax-machine, a bathroom suite equipped with a massive jacuzzy bath tub (easily fits two!), built-in wardrobe, a giant mirror over the a double washbasin and separate WC and shower units. The decor is modern and stylish, which is refreshing for a hotel in Penang (I've stayed in at least 7 different ones over the years).

Amenities at the hotel include a smallish but cosy infinity pool, a gymnasium (if it's not big enough for you gym-bunnies, Fitness Studio across the road charges RM40/£6 for a week pass), spa and massage service (RM90/£15 onwards), a business centre and two restaurants (the adequate buffet breakfast is a steal at RM23/£4 a head).
reviews.title: Top Hotel

reviews.text: The staff are very efficient and helpful; The clientele of the hotel consists mainly of business men and young professionals on business trips, which suited me well as opposed to families with kids at other establishments nearby.
reviews.title: Very good value for money

reviews.text: Great location in centrak Georgetown, lovely views, especially from the pool. Nice spa bath, clean, large room. Good breakfast selection. No complaints really, but missed five star rating as no wow factor and over priced for Malaysia. However, I think that it is p;robably the best you are going to find in Penang in the price range.
reviews.title: Pretty nice hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the Northam for three nights in July. From the moment we arrived we had problems. We had to wait two hours to check into our rooms and I'm fully convinced that they would have left us another two hours had we not put our foot down.
reviews.title: Horrible hotel, horrible staff
Superb
reviews.text: The staff were very unfriendly and unhelpful and I got a distinct feeling that we were only viewed as dollar signs from the minute we walked in the door.
The pool area is ok but don't be fooled by the photograph on the web site. It doesnn't look any like that.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I was with two older relatives who were unable to make the 15 minute into the centre of george town, thus it meant getting a taxi each time. Getting a taxi gave the hotel another opportunity to rip us off and order a taxi at five times the normal price that we should have paid. CHARMING!
reviews.title: Best Suite Hotel In Penang

reviews.text: I am sooo glad when a friend of mine invited me for a talk on neuroradiology, veneued in this hotel.
reviews.title: A Wow Factor.

reviews.text: I'm also extremely thankful for all the reviews written in this site on this particular hotel - giving me the confidence to book a night stay here.
reviews.title: A Satisfactory Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, i ask the room rate and when i was told that it is RM200, i am expecting a different room (from those described in the reviews).
reviews.title: Large, Clean, but little Character

reviews.text: I ask to check in early...around 10am, the receptionist comply to this request, putting it under 'confirmed booking' instead of the usual 'reserved'. That is ok by me.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When i arrived, checking in at 10.30am, the process was a breeze and fast. Unlike the usual long, standing, check in counter, i was seated on a 1 to 1 counter-table, with the complimentary drink served on the table within 30seconds.
reviews.title: Genuine 4 star hotel

likes.disliked: — never pay the rack rate!! Get a good discount. I got half price!!!

description: The Northam All Suite, Penang is strategically located in the heart of Penang's commercial and leisure district. The hotel offers easy access to the city's historical and cultural landmarks. The spacious suites, refined with homely earth tone finishings, Jacuzzi and modern amenities will pamper your every whim.The 142 splendidly furnished and cozy suites are replete with opulent accommodations complete with panoramic views of the iridescent sea. Watch the sky light up in a glorious sunrise or end the evening with the sunset as day turns to dusk. This is a stay in ultimate indulgence. The Hotel is located in the heart of the new business and commercial district and less than five minutes away from all major shopping complexes and Gurney Drive. It is 20 km away from the Penang International Airport, approximately 20 minutes by road or 4 hours drive via the North-South Expressway from Malaysia's capital city, Kuala Lumpur.
